title: Instagram says workers must be in the office every day in 2026
snippets: The RTO policy only applies to Instagram and not to Meta's other family of apps, like Facebook and WhatsApp.
Instagram back-to-office policy: Adam Mosseri demands full-time in-person work in 2026, fewer meetings, and faster product prototypes.
titles: Meta's Instagram orders employees back to the office 5 days a week
Instagram chief Adam Mosseri orders staff back to the office five days a week in 2026
summary: Instagram has announced a new return-to-office policy requiring employees to work full-time in person starting in 2026. The policy, outlined by Instagram head Adam Mosseri, also aims to reduce the number of meetings and accelerate product prototyping. This policy applies only to Instagram and does not affect Meta's other platforms, such as Facebook or WhatsApp.
constructiveness_reason: This story provides useful information about Instagram's future office policies, which could impact readers who work in or are interested in the tech industry. However, it does not report on solutions, improvements, or innovations, nor does it increase clarity around systems, causes, trends, or impacts.

title: Sagittarius B2 Molecular Cloud
snippets: NASA's James Webb Space Telescope took a look at the Sagittarius B2 molecular cloud, the most massive, and active star-forming region in our galaxy, located only a few hundred light years from our central supermassive black hole.

The Mid-Infrared Instrument (MIRI) on NASA’s James Webb Space Telescope captured glowing cosmic dust heated by very young massive stars in unprecedented detail in this image of the Sagittarius B2 (Sgr B2) molecular cloud released on Sept. 24, 2025.
